Package dk.via.sep.shared.networking.eventServerRemote

Interface EventServerCallback

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    EventServer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EventServerHandler
    public interface EventServerCallback
extends java.rmi.Remote
    Callback interface for the event server, extends remote so it is accessible over the network by the client. Every method here is only called by the client. If you wish to add methods that the client should not have access to, do so in the EventServer interface. All methods written here need to throw a RemoteException, as per RMI's specification.

    • Method Summary

      void createEvent​(Event event)
      Method used to create an event in the database.
      void editEvent​(Event newEvent)
      Method used to edit an event from the database.
      java.util.ArrayList<Event> getEventList()
      Deprecated.
      User the async version instead.

      Method used to get the list of events asynchronous.

      Method used to retrieve the list of users of an event from the database.

    • Method Detail

      • registerGeneralClientCallback

        void registerGeneralClientCallback​(EventClientCallback clientCallback)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method used to register a client to a general callback. A general callback will notify every active user of an event.
        Parameters:
        clientCallback - the client's callback interface, so it can be accessed by the server.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the connection cannot be established.

      • registerClientCallback

        void registerClientCallback​(EventClientCallback clientCallback,
                            java.util.UUID uuid)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method used to register a client to a private callback. A private callback will notify only the specified user, and no one else. If you need to send a private set of data, you need to provide the client's UUID which is created at start-up and changes every time the program is opened.
        Parameters:
        clientCallback - the client's callback interface
        uuid - the client's UUID
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the connection cannot be established.

      • createEvent

        void createEvent​(Event event)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method used to create an event in the database. May only be called by a user with administrator privileges.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to be added.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the connection cannot be established.

      • removeEvent

        void removeEvent​(Event event)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method used to remove an event from the database. May only be called by a user with administrator privileges.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to be removed.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the connection cannot be established.

      • editEvent

        void editEvent​(Event newEvent)
        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method used to edit an event from the database. You need to provide the changes through an event object which has the same id as the event you're editing, otherwise the event DAO will throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        newEvent - the event to be edited, along with the changes made to it.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the connection cannot be established.

      • getEventList

        java.util.ArrayList<Event> getEventList()
                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated.
        User the async version instead.
        Method used to retrieve the event list from the database.
        Returns:
        the event list.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the connection cannot be established.

      • joinEvent

        boolean joinEvent​(User user,
                  Event event,
                  boolean b)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method used to join a user to an event.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to be added to an event.
        event - the event to add the user to.
        b - boolean if the user decides to ride the bus to the event or not.
        Returns:
        boolean if the operation was successful or not.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the connection cannot be established.

      • leaveEvent

        boolean leaveEvent​(User user,
                   Event event)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method used to remove a user from an event.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to be removed from an event.
        event - the event to be removed from.
        Returns:
        boolean if the operation was successful or not.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the connection cannot be established.

      • getUserList

        java.util.ArrayList<User> getUserList​(Event event)
                               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method used to retrieve the list of users of an event from the database.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to get the list from.
        Returns:
        the list of users.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the connection cannot be established.

      • getEventListASync

        void getEventListASync​(java.util.UUID clientID)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method used to get the list of events asynchronous. This method will then call another method that will send the event list back to the client that requested it.
        Parameters:
        clientID - the client's UUID, necessary to send back the list to the client that requested it.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the connection cannot be established.
